meanings.definition: A slit or loop through which a button is passed to fasten a garment.
meanings.sent1: She carefully sewed a buttonhole on her dress.
meanings.sent2: The tailor added buttonholes to the coat for the buttons.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to play with the buttonhole on the shirt.
meanings.sent4: The buttonhole on the jacket was like a tiny doorway for the button.
meanings.sent5: The buttonhole looked like a small mouth waiting to be fed a button.

meanings.sent1: She used the sewing machine to buttonhole the fabric.
meanings.sent2: The tailor buttonholes the shirts with precision.
meanings.sent3: He decided to buttonhole his socks for fun.
meanings.sent4: The chef buttonholes the dough to make dumplings.
meanings.sent5: The machine buttonholes the leather effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To accost and detain (a person) in conversation.
meanings.sent1: She tried to buttonhole him at the party to discuss the project.
meanings.sent2: The politician buttonholed the reporter for an interview.
meanings.sent3: The friendly neighbor buttonholed him to chat about the weather.
meanings.sent4: The salesman buttonholed every passerby to promote his product.
meanings.sent5: The teacher buttonholed the student to talk about their grades.
